Error: Invalid character. You can only use numeric characters and \'.\'.

EasySal Salary Calculator is a simple way to calculate your salary. You can calculate your salary based on several different salary options: 
	-Hourly 
	-Daily 
	-Weekly 
	-Every two weeks 
	-Monthly 
	-Yearly 

EasySal also gives the option of taking overtime pay into consideration. Overtime pay can be based on either the United States minimum of one and a half times the normal pay for any hours worked over full-time (40 hours) or twice the normal pay.
Note: Overtime not taken into consideration.
The overtime setting is turned on, yet the hours you entered does not qualify as overtime hours. In this case, overtime will not be considered.
Check if you would like to incorporate overtime.
Check if you would like to display 31 day month (default: only shows 30 days).
Check if you would like to incorporate federal taxes.
Select tax rate (e.g. single, married, etc).
Select method for entering in hours worked on a biweekly salary.
You must enter a value for how many hours you worked!
You must enter a value for your salary!
The entry for your salary is invalid. Please try again with a valid number (e.g. only one decimal point).
The entry for your number of hours worked is invalid. Please try again with a valid number (e.g. only one decimal point).
There was an error converting your salary. Make sure to enter a valid number (e.g. only one decimal point).
There was an error converting your hours worked. Make sure to enter a valid number (e.g. only one decimal point).
There aren\'t that many hours in the week! Oh well, curiosity never hurt anybody...
What planet are you from? Here on Earth, there\'s only 24 hours in a day.
Um...yeah, there\'s only 168 hours in the week.
I highly doubt that you work more hours than there are in two weeks!
Wow, really? Do you have the power of the Force? Working that many hours is insane!
